Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly an eye cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of possibly part of eye and eyebrow; to right, undetermined decoration with part of vine spray.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 92 no. 318 pl. 69)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 450, no. B748, pl. CCXXIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1418) (phase 3)
